citations.narrative:
The facility is allowing volunteers to provide large quantities of fruits (bananas, pineapples, strawberries, tomatoes,
mangos) and vegetables to the bison herd twice a week. During these supplemental feedings, the fruits and vegetables
have comprised approximately 25% or more of the animals' diet for the day. The bison appear to be in good body
condition, however, the animal caretaker has observed more frequent occurrences of diarrhea and recent health concerns
in the herd.
Feeding bison a variable diet that is high in carbohydrates and simple sugars can cause digestive upset which could lead
to systemic disease.
Food shall be of sufficient quantity and nutritive value to maintain all animals in good health, and shall be prepared with
consideration for the species, condition, and type of animal.
Correct by ensuring that the bison are receiving a balanced diet consistent with the attending veterinarian's
recommendations.
Correct by : December 31, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
